newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen falling on year-end selling.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen falling on year-end selling.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) may fall further amid a continuing market correction when the market reopens on Thursday after the Christmas holiday, brokers said.
"The share prices may fall further amid continuing market correction. There are some scrips which are still overvalued. The market is stabilising ahead of year-end," said broker M. Morshed.

But another broker said the small investors were panicked by a persistent downwards trend in the market. The DSE benchmark index closed 55.73 points or 2.34 percent down at 2,319.64 on 18.9 million taka on Tuesday. -- Dhaka Newsroom +880-2-506363
